snippet: New York City violated federal law because its emergency management plans failed to address the needs of the disabled during Tropical Storm Irene, the government said on Friday.
abstract: Federal authorities submit document to Federal District Court in Manhattan asserting that New York City is in violation of federal law because its emergency management plans do not adequately protect rights of individuals with disabilities; city's Law Department says it strongly disagrees with accusation.
lead_paragraph: New York City violated federal law because its emergency management plans failed to address the needs of the disabled during Tropical Storm Irene, the government said on Friday.

headline.main: Storm Plans for Disabled Are Inadequate, U.S. Says
headline.print_headline: Storm Plans For Disabled Inadequate, U.S. Says
